item.description:
Celebrate the holiday season with Buddha's enlightenment. This Buddhist holiday remembers the day the historical Buddha attained enlightenment under the bodhi tree over 2,500 years ago in Bodh Gaya, India. Event includes video presentation of the story, music and chants and more. All are welcome. Great from families. Lead by Daishin Senpai.

 

On Bodhi Day Sunday
In honor of Sandy Hook Elementary School

December 23, 2012


Wear Green and White. On Bodhi Day Sunday we are encouraging member and friends to wear green and while on solidarity with the victims and their families. Green and white are the colors of Sandy Hook Elementary School. If you do not have clothing with these colors, no problem; don’t feel like you can’t attend the gathering. Also, don’t feel as if you need to purchase something green either. However, if you do have something green and white to wear, you are certainly welcomed to do so.

26 Bells will be rung in mindfulness at the beginning of the Sunday morning gathering on in honor and reflection of the 26 children and heroes of Sandy Hook tragedy.

 

Visit our main website  at www.bffct.net for Calendar and more information on our beliefs and practices.

 

p.s. REMINDER - Hosted by the Buddhist Faith Fellowship. Even though just one or two people from Meetup have RSVPed, you can expect 35 - 45 people in attendance.
